subject: Re: [junit] jdk 1.4 error
msgSnippet: Which version of JUnit are you running?  Thanks, David Saff P.S. Anyone out there have influence with Sun?  Surely we could get better error messages than
messageBody:
Which version of JUnit are you running? Thanks,

David Saff

P.S. Anyone out there have influence with Sun? Surely we could get
better error messages than "Unsupported major.minor version 49.0".

smaroukla wrote:
> hi,
> I'm trying to run JUnit under jdk 1.4 by typing
> java junit.textui.TestRunner junit.samples.AllTests
> and I receive the following error
>
> Registry key 'Software\JavaSoft\Java Runtime Environment\CurrentVersion'
> has value '1.4', but '1.3' is required.
> Error: could not find java.dll
> Error: could not find Java 2 Runtime Environment.
>
> I'm also trying to run a TestCase from Eclipse and I receive the
> following error
> The java class could not be loaded.
> java.lang.UnsupportedClassVersionError: junit/framework/TestListener
> (Unsupported major.minor version 49.0)
>
> Could anyone help me?
>
> Thanks
>
>
>
>
>
>
>
